result.execSummary:
The defendant Lucias Anthony Herron was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Dangerous Weapon at School, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.61(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: All financial obligations paid through the Clerk of Courts office are subject to civil judgment and certification to the Department of Revenue on any balance owed after 60 days from entry of judgment.  Payment plan of $50 a month starting on or before 11/1/22 and on or before the first of every month till paid in full.

All financial obligations paid through the Clerk of Courts office are subject to civil judgment and certification to the Department of Revenue on any balance owed after 60 days from entry of judgment.  Payment plan of $50 a month starting on or before 11/1/22 and on or before the first of every month till paid in full.
The Def is to contact Ashland Co Jail to make arrangements to provide a DNA specimen w/in 7 days.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
AMENDED
COVERS CASES 22CM34 AND 22CM54
Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons or explosives.
Def to have NO Contact w/ any schools.
Not to be within 2 blocks of any schools, exception for AHS if and only if he is on his way or coming from MMC.  Can drive past school, but has to be going to/from some place.  No walking, jogging, or hanging around by school.

8:32 AM Defendant Lucias Anthony Herron in court.  Attorney Paul Arbuckle in court for Lucias Anthony Herron.  Attorney Ruth Diane Kressel appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 22CM34 and 22CM54.  Parties have agreement.  State has complied with victim rights.  Def understands charges and penalties.  Atty, def pleads NO CONTEST, def agrees.  PLQ and DEJ filed, no signed DEJ.  Atty, handed over the signature page earlier to the DA office.  Back on the record at 8:39.  Def, agrees signed the documents, understands information, rights giving up, and elements.  Def, asks court to accept the DEJ.  Atty is satisfied.  Court is satisfied and accepts NO CONTEST pleas and entering the DEJ.  As a factual basis can the court rely on the information in the complaints, parties agree.  Court finds factual basis exists and finds def GUILTY, direct judgment to enter in 22CM34 and DEJ in 22CM54.  State comments on sentencing.  Atty makes comment on sentencing.  Court accepts and makes the DEJ order of the court.  Atty, payment plan of $50 a month starting on or before 11/1/22 and on or before the first of every month till paid in full.  22CM34 under age of 25 at the time of event and is successfully completes sentence and commits no more convictions the case can be expunged.
